snippet: When Brazil lost to Germany, 7-1, on Tuesday, it lost something much larger than a game in a country where pride over five previous World Cup championships is forged into the national identity.
abstract: Across Brazil, where pride over five World Cup championships is forged into national identity, people are struggling to make sense of country's stunning 7-1 loss to Germany and are searching for a way to move on.

byline.original: By SIMON ROMERO and SETH KUGEL
byline.contributor: Simon Romero reported from Rio de Janeiro, and Seth Kugel from São Paulo, Brazil. Mariana Simões contributed reporting from Rio de Janeiro, and Paula Ramon from São Paulo.

lead_paragraph: When Brazil lost to Germany, 7-1, on Tuesday, it lost something much larger than a game in a country where pride over five previous World Cup championships is forged into the national identity.

headline.seo: In Brazil, World Cup Loss to Germany Looms Large
headline.main: Stunned Brazilians Try to Move On After Their Exalted Team Falls
headline.print_headline: Stunned Brazilians Try to Move On After Their Exalted Team Falls
